subtitle: How do I know I’m pregnant?
title: How do I know I’m pregnant?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Are you pregnant? How can you tell? The surest sign is a missed period, but you may find it hard to remember the date of your last period.

Do you have any of these signs of pregnancy?

 - 	Your breasts look and feel different 

 - 	You notice some spots of blood in your underwear 

 - 	You feel nauseous

 - 	You need to pee more than usual 

 - 	You miss a period

If you think you are pregnant, it is best if you see a doctor, nurse or midwife. The earlier you find out, the sooner you can start planning for your new baby. A doctor will also be able to give you advice and help while you are pregnant.

A nurse or midwife will weigh you, check your blood pressure and test your urine. 

Worried about seeing a doctor? Ask a friend to go with you.
